intro: Silene portensis subsp. portensis, commonly known as the Portensian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branched. Silene portensis subsp. portensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand dry and saline conditions.
